get.summary: Get a queue definition by identifier
get.description: Get a queue definition by its identifier.

parameters.name: queueIdent
parameters.description: The identifier of the queue to fetch

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: if-none-match HTTP header value (for e-tag evaluation).

put.summary: Update the properties of an existing queue
put.description:
Update the properties of an existing queue.

This endpoint allows authenticated users with the "VERIFIED_ROLE" to update the properties of an existing queue given by its identifier. The queue's configuration properties are provided in the request body.

parameters.name: queueIdent
parameters.description: The identifier of the queue to be updated

requestBody.description: The updated queue configuration properties.

delete.summary: Delete a queue given by its identifier
delete.description: Delete a queue given by its identifier.

parameters.name: queueIdent
parameters.description: The identifier of the queue to be deleted

patch.summary: Update the properties of an existing queue
patch.description:
Update the properties of an existing queue.

This endpoint allows authenticated users with the "VERIFIED_ROLE" to update the properties of an existing queue given by its identifier. The queue's configuration properties are provided in the request body.

parameters.name: queueIdent
parameters.description: The identifier of the queue to be updated

requestBody.description: The updated queue configuration properties.

get.description:
Get all URLs in the post given by its Id.

parameters.description: The Id of the post to fetch URLs from

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before returning results

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return

put.summary: Update all post URLs on a post given by Id
put.description:

 post URLs on a post given by its Id.

parameters.name: postId
parameters.description: The Id of the post to update

requestBody.description: A list of PostUrlConfigRequest objects representing the URLs on the post.

get.summary: Get the status of a post given by its Id
get.description:
Get the status of a post given by its Id.

 This endpoint allows authenticated users with the "VERIFIED_ROLE" to get the status of a
 posts given by its Id.  The status of a post is given by the PostPubStatus enumeration.

put.summary: Update the publication status of the post given by Id
put.description:
Update the publication status of the post given by Id.

 This endpoint allows authenticated users with the "VERIFIED_ROLE" to update the
 publication status of a post given by its Id. The status can be 'PUB_PENDING',
 'DEPUB_PENDING', or null.

parameters.name: postId
parameters.description: The Id of the post to update

requestBody.description: The request containing the updated post status.

post.description:
Create a new feed queue with the provided configuration.

This endpoint is used to create a new feed queue with the provided configuration. A feed queue is a structure used to manage, organize, and publish syndicated content in various formats such as RSS 2.0, ATOM, and JSON.

requestBody.description: A queue configuration request.

get.summary: Get the published timestamp of a post given by its Id.
get.description:

copyright.description: The copyright information of the queue.

imgSrc.description: The image source of the queue.

title.description:
The title of the queue. If you have a website that contains the same information as your queue, the title of your queue should be the same as the title of your website.

RSS2: channel -> title ATOM1: feed -> title

Example: GoUpstate.com News Headlines

description.description:
Phrase or sentence describing the queue.

RSS2: channel -> description ATOM1: feed -> subtitle

Example: The latest news from GoUpstate.com, a Spartanburg Herald-Journal Website.

generator.description:
A string indicating the program used to generate the syndicated feed artifact.

RSS2: channel -> generator ATOM1: feed -> generator

Example: MightyInHouse Content System v2.3

transportIdent.description:
The transport identifier of the queue.  This value is used to uniquely locate this queue within the FeedGears RSS
 platform.

copyright.description:
Copyright notice for content in the queue.

RSS2: channel -> copyright ATOM1: feed -> rights

Example: Copyright 2002, Spartanburg Herald-Journal

language.description:
The language the queue is published in. This allows aggregators to group all Italian language sites, for example, on a single page. A list of allowable values for this element, as provided by Netscape, is here. You may also use values defined by the W3C.

RSS2: channel -> language ATOM1: feed -> language

Example: en-us

queueImgSrc.description:
Specifies a GIF, JPEG or PNG image that can be displayed with the channel.

This value is used to construct the image sub-element of the RSS 2.0 channel element, as well as the image and logo sub-elements of the ATOM 1.0 feed element.

RSS2: channel -> image ATOm1: feed -> icon, feed -> logo

lastDeployed.description:
The timestamp when the queue was last deployed (built and published). This, this value corresponds to the RSS 2.0 pubDate and lastBuildDate fields.

pubDate represents the publication date for the content in the channel. For example, the New York Times publishes on a daily basis, the publication date flips once every 24 hours. That's when the pubDate of the channel changes. All date-times in RSS conform to the Date and Time Specification of RFC 822, with the exception that the year may be expressed with two characters or four characters (four preferred).

lastBuildDate is the last time the content of the channel changed.

RSS2: channel -> lastBuildDate ATOM1: feed -> updated

Example: Sat, 07 Sep 2002 09:42:31 GMT

isAuthenticated.description:
Whether authentication is required for the queue.  Queues that require authentication are only accessible via BASIC
 authentication, when the username and password pair correspond to a QueueCredential entity defined for this queue.

QueueDTO.description:
A response model for a queue.  Objects of this type are returned when users invoke the API to fetch all
 queues defined for a specific user, or to create a new queue, or to update an existing one.

deployResponses.description: The results of deployment on all publishers.

QueueConfigResponse.description: A response model for queue configuration operations.

isRequired.description: The new authentication requirement to be set for the queue.

postContents.description: A list of ContentObject objects (the post content)

postUrls.description: A list of alternate post URLs

postComment.description:
A URL of a page for comments relating to the post.

Example: http://ekzemplo.com/entry/4403/comments

postRights.description: The rights associated with the post.

contributors.description: The list of contributors to the post.

authors.description: The list of authors of the post.

postCategories.description:
The list of categories associated with the post.

Example: Grateful Dead

expirationTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the post will expire.

enclosures.description: A list of media objects that are attached to the post.

length.description: The length of the enclosure in bytes.

author.description: The author associated with this post

isExplicitNullable.description: Indicates if the explicit status is nullable

image.description: The URL of the image associated with the post

imageUri.description: The URI of the image associated with the post

PostITunes.description: Represents iTunes-specific metadata associated with a post.

email.description: The email address of the person.

hreflang.description: The language of the content at the URL.

rel.description: The relationship of the URL to the current document.

ident.description: A unique identifier for this entity.

type.description: The type of the content object.

value.description: The value of the content object.

ContentObject.description: Represents a content object within a post.

id.description: The unique identifier of the post.

queueIdent.description: The identifier of the queue to which the post belongs.

postContents.description:
A list of (HTML or text) content objects that are attached to the post.

RSS2: item -> content ATOM1: entry -> contents

postUrl.description:
The (primary) post URL. This is optional for RSS2 channel items, and required for ATOM1 feed entries.

RSS2: item -> link, item -> URI ATOM1: entry -> id

postUrls.description:
A list of alternate post URLs.

ATOM1: entry -> otherLinks

importTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the post was imported.

postComment.description:
A URL of a page for comments relating to the post.

RSS2: item -> comments

Example: http://ekzemplo.com/entry/4403/comments

postRights.description:
The rights associated with the post.

ATOM1: entry -> rights

contributors.description:
A list of contributors to the post.

ATOM1: entry -> contributors

authors.description:
A list of authors of the post.

RSS2: item -> author ATOM1: entry -> authors

postCategories.description:
A list of categories associated with the post.

RSS2: item -> categories ATOm1: entry -> categories

Example: Grateful Dead

publishTimestamp.description:
The timestamp of when the post was published.

RSS2: item -> pubDate ATOM1: entry -> published

expirationTimestamp.description:
The timestamp of when the post will expire.

RSS2: item -> expirationDate

enclosures.description:
A list of media objects that are attached to the post.

RSS2: item -> enclosures

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description:
The timestamp of the last update to the post.

ATOM1: entry -> updated

PostDTO.description: A response model for a post.

ident.description: A unique identifier for this entity.

length.description: The length of the enclosure in bytes.

PostEnclosure.description: Represents an enclosure associated with a post.

ident.description: A unique identifier for this entity.

email.description: The email address of the person.

PostPerson.description: Represents a person associated with a post.

ident.description: A unique identifier for this entity.

hreflang.description: The language of the content at the URL.

rel.description: The relationship of the URL to the current document.

PostUrl.description: Represents a URL associated with a post.

newStatus.description: The new status to be set for the post.

postMediaGroups.description: List of media groups associated with the post.

postMediaContents.description: List of media contents associated with the post.

PostMedia.description: Represents media information associated with a post.

basicUsername.description: The username associated with this credential.

basicPassword.description: The password associated with this credential.

id.description: The unique identifier of the queue credential.

created.description: The timestamp the queue was created.

lastModified.description: The timestamp the queue was last modified in any way.

QueueCredential.description: Represents a credential for a feed queue.
